details.title: Pre-Parliament session drama
details.content:
• The 8 suspended MPs camping out in the Parliament lawns had a surprise visitor in Rajya Sabha deputy chairman Harivansh who visited them with morning tea.  
  • Harivansh Ji said he came to meet us as a colleague & not as Deputy Chairman of Rajya Sabha. He also brought some tea & snacks for us. We started this sit-in demonstration yesterday as a protest against our suspension. We've been here all night: Congress MP Ripun Bora
  • Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh to observe one-day fast against the unruly behaviour with him in the House by Opposition MPs during the passing of agriculture Bills on 20th September

details.title: Opposition will boycott Rajya Sabha session till demands are not met: LoP Azad
details.content:
Till our demands which include revocation of suspension of the 8 MPs and Govt to bring another bill under which no private player can purchase below MSP are not met, the Opposition will boycott the session: LoP & Congress Rajya Sabha MP Ghulam Nabi Azad https://t.co/lqwgTGj4KK

— ANI (@ANI) September 22, 2020

details.title: Opposition leaders stage walk-out from Rajya Sabha; protest before Gandhi statue
details.content:
Delhi: Opposition leaders stage walk-out from Rajya Sabha; protest before Gandhi statue in Parliament premises, demanding revocation of suspended MPs pic.twitter.com/840pdRVJMl

— ANI (@ANI) September 22, 2020

details.title: 'Inspiring and statesman like conduct': PM Modi praises RS Dy Chair Harivansh for offering tea to protesting oppostion MPs
details.content:
To personally serve tea to those who "attacked and insulted" him a few days ago as well as those sitting on dharna, Modi tweeted, shows that Harivansh has been blessed with a humble mind and a big heart.

It shows his greatness, the prime minister said and added that he joins the people of India in congratulating Harivansh. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Action has been taken on their conduct: RS Chairman Naidu on 8 members suspension
details.content:
I am not happy about the suspension of the members. The action has been taken on their conduct. We have nothing against any member: Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu pic.twitter.com/dDguuc2wbw

— ANI (@ANI) September 22, 2020

details.title: Opposition denying their mistake, holding RS Dy Chairman responsible for ruckus: Thawarchand Gehlot
details.content:
Opposition denies their mistake and is holding Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman responsible for ruckus during passage of #FarmBills: Leader of House @TCGEHLOT @NewIndianXpress

— richa sharma (@richa_TNIE) September 22, 2020

details.title: 'Rethink, introspect, return to House': RS Chairman Naidu urges Opposition leaders
details.content:
Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu urges Opposition leaders to "rethink, introspect, return to the House to take part in discussions". https://t.co/4LDv5gWBiX

— ANI (@ANI) September 22, 2020

details.title: I apologised but no response: Samajwadi Party MP Ram Gopal Yadav
details.content:
I am a senior Member of Parliament, I have apologised for what happened in the House, but I didn't get any response. I found this very insulting. My party has decided to boycott the entire session: Samajwadi Party Rajya Sabha MP Ram Gopal Yadav pic.twitter.com/M9ooWWprN7

— ANI (@ANI) September 22, 2020

details.title: Anguish and pain: RS Dy Chairman Harivansh to observe 1 day fast
details.content:
Expressing his deep anguish and pain at opposition members' "humiliating" conduct towards him, Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairperson Harivansh on Tuesday announced a 24-hour long fast, hoping that this may inspire a feeling of "self-purification" in them.

In a letter to Rajya Sabha Chairperson M Venkaiah Naidu, Harivansh recounted the ruckus in the House on Sunday during the passage of farm bills. (Read full report here)

details.title: NCP chief Sharad Pawar to address press at 12 PM, likely to clear party's stand over Farm Bills
details.content:
NCP chief Sharad Pawar will address the press today at 12.00 noon at NCP office, Mumbai. Sharad Pawar likely to clear his party stand over the controversial #FarmBills2020 @NewIndianXpress @Sunday_Standard @NCPspeaks @PawarSpeaks

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) September 22, 2020

details.title: Suspended MPs end dharna
details.content:
So all the opposition parties boycotted the rest of the session. They appealed to all the people who were sitting at the dharna to finish it & join them in boycotting the rest of the session. That is how we have ended this dharna: Syed Nasir Hussain, Congress Rajya Sabha MP https://t.co/iDptDbqAgj

— ANI (@ANI) September 22, 2020

details.title: Parliament passes the The Indian Institutes of Information Technology Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2020
details.content:
Parliament passes the The Indian Institutes of Information Technology Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2020, with RajyaSabha clearing it today

The Bill seeks to declare 5 IIITs set up under the PPP mode in 
Surat
Bhopal
Bhagalpur
Agartala
Raichur as institutions of national importance.

details.content:
Rajya Sabha has taken up the Essential Commodities (Amendment) Bill 2020 for passage pic.twitter.com/j2tgLNQEd2

Parliament passes bill to remove cereals, pulses, oilseeds, edible oils, onion and potatoes from list of essential commodities

details.content:

details.title: Rajya Sabha passes fourth Bill
details.content: The Rajya Sabha amid Opposition boycott passed the Companies (Amendment) Bill, 2020.

details.title: Rajya Sabha passes fifth Bill within minutes
details.content: The Rajya Sabha passes the National Forensic Sciences University Bill, 2020, within minutes.

details.title: Third farm bill cleared as RS passes amendments to essential commodities law
details.content: Parliament on Tuesday passed a bill to remove cereals, pulses, oilseeds, edible oils, onion and potatoes from the list of essential commodities. The Essential Commodities (Amendment) Bill, which was approved by the lower house on September 15, was approved by a voice vote in Rajya Sabha. (READ MORE)

details.title: Rajya Sabha passes 6 Bills in three hours
details.content:
Amid Opposition boycott, the Upper House of the Parliament passed the sixth Bill- Rashtriya Raksha University Bill, 2020.

The seventh Bill has been introduced.

details.title: Rajya Sabha adjourned for the day
details.content:
Rahya Sabha returns Taxation and Other Laws (Relaxation & Amendment of Certain Provisions) Bill, 2020.

The House is adjourned for the day.

details.title: Lok Sabha to convene at 3PM
details.content: The Lower House of the Parliament will meet at 3 PM today.

details.title: Youth Congress activists shout slogans against Farm Bills
details.content:
Indian Youth Congress activists shout slogans as they protest against the rise in unemployment and against #FarmBill2020 in New Delhi.
Express photo | @parveennegi1 @TheMornStandard @shibasahu2012 pic.twitter.com/NIof3J4YZW

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) September 22, 2020

details.title: Farm bills: SAD to hold 'chakka jaam' in Punjab
details.content: The Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD), the BJP's oldest ally, on Tuesday announced road blockades across Punjab on September 25 to protest against the contentious farm Bills passed by Parliament. Rajya Sabha passed the Essential Commodities (Amendment) Bill, 2020 during the day. (READ MORE)

details.title: Lok Sabha convenes amid ruckus
details.content: Lok Sabha was adjourned for an hour after the Opposition MPs started sloganeering over the contentious Farm Bills.

details.title: Lok Sabha reconvenes
details.content: Lok Sabha reconvenes after an hour. Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury demands retraction of Farm Bills.

details.title: Opposition led by Congress boycott Lok Sabha
details.content:
Congress' Adhir further demands withdrawal of the three Farm Bills referring to them as anti-farmer. Speaker Om Birla says Bills passed in the Rajya Sabha will not be discussed in the Lower House.

The Opposition parties led by Congress has decided to boycott the remaining Lok Sabha session.

details.title: No normalcy in J&K till 370 restored: Abdullah
details.content: Former J&K chief minister and Srinagar MP Farooq Abdullah says, " if the government does not take back steps taken on August 5 in 2019 , normalcy can never be restored".

details.title: Floor leaders of Congress, other Opposition parties meet Speaker
details.content: Opposition MPs, including Congress' Adhir Ranjan Choudhary and NCP's Supriya Sule, hold a meeting in Parliament premises after boycotting the ongoing Lok Sabha session.

details.title: Speaker holds meeting with Opposition MPS
details.content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla is holding a meeting with members of Opposition parties after they announced boycott of the session in solidarity with suspended Rajya Sabha MPs and in opposition of the farm Bills.

details.title: BJD, YSRCP back labour safety Bills
details.content:
BJD leader Pinaki Misra and YSRCP leader Margani Bharat extended their support to the labour safety Bills. 

The Lower House will consider the Occupational Safety, Health And Working Conditions Code, 2020, the Industrial Relations Code, 2020 and the Code on Social Security, 2020.

details.title: 5 Opposition MPs to boycott House advisory meet
details.content: Five Opposition MPs including Jairam Ramesh and Derek O'Brien to boycott the meeting of the Rajya Sabha Business Advisory Committee scheduled at 6 PM today.

details.title: Over 1 crore migrant workers returned to home states on foot during Mar-Jun: Govt
details.content: "COVID-19 has resulted in migration of large number of workers from destination states to the home-states,” Minister of State for Road Transport and Highways V K Singh told Lok Sabha in a written reply. As per the data compiled by Ministry of Labour and Employment, more than 1.06 crore migrant workers, including those who travelled on foot during the lockdown, returned to their home states, he said. (PTI)

details.title: TDP supports labour codes
details.content: TDP's Jayadev Galla extended his party's support to the three labour codes.

details.title: Parliament likely to be adjourned sine die on Wednesday
details.content: Both the Houses of the Parliament is likely to be adjourned sine die on Wednesday, eight days ahead of the scheduled end of the Monsoon Session, amid concerns of spread of coronavirus among lawmakers, sources said on Tuesday. (READ MORE)

details.title: Govt says data on migrant workers soon
details.content: Labour Minister Santosh Kumar Gangwar in Lok Sabha said, "this government gives importance to the plight of migrant workers. Several initiatives for workers' benefit have been introduced. The government will bring a provision for database on migrant workers".

details.title: My way or the highway approach is unacceptable: Naidu
details.content: Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu on Tuesday lauded Deputy Chairman Harivansh for showing restraint when opposition members were agitating in the House and disapproved of the conduct of the protesting leaders, saying the "my way or the highway" approach is unacceptable. (READ MORE)

details.title: Lok Sabha passes labour Bill
details.content: Amid Opposition boycott, Lok Sabha passes the Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020, the Industrial Relations Code 2020 and the Code on Social Security Bill, 2020.

details.title: The Jammu and Kashmir Official Languages Bill 2020 introduced
details.content: Lok Sabha introduces Bill to add Kashmiri, Dogri and Hindi, apart from the existing Urdu and English, to be the official languages in the union territory of Jammu and Kashmir.

details.title: Lok Sabha to convene at 6 PM tomorrow
details.content: The Lok Sabha will convene at 6 PM tomorrow are is likely to be adjourned sine die.

details.title: Another Bill passes in haste
details.content: The Jammu and Kashmir Official Languages Bill 2020 has been passed in the Lok Sabha within minutes.

details.title: Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh breaks his one-day fast
details.content:
Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh on Wednesday broke his one-day fast, he has started on Tuesday to protest the unruly behaviour towards him by some Opposition members during the passage of agriculture Bills in the Upper House on September 20.

Janata Dal (U) MP Rajiv Ranjan Singh alias Lalan Singh offered juice to Harivansh to help him break the fast.

(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Govt has decided to recommend adjournement of Rajya Sabha sine die today: MoS Parliamentary Affairs V Muraleedharan
details.content:
I've to inform members that the Govt has decided to recommend adjournment of the House sine die today. But some important legislative business passed by Lok Sabha has to be disposed off before adjournment of the House sine die: MoS for MEA & Parliamentary Affairs, V Muraleedharan pic.twitter.com/aUtCju652C

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: Opposition parties, that boycotted Rajya Sabha session, have called a meeting at the office of LoP in the House
details.content:
The meeting has been called by opposition parties, that boycotted Rajya Sabha session, to discuss further strategy on the farm bills passed in Parliament.

It will be held at the office of Leader of Opposition in the House, Ghulam Nabi Azad in the Parliament later today. https://t.co/DQQ9TIOq58

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: FCRA Bill's motive is to ensure foreign funds don't dominate India's political and social discourse: MoS MHA
details.content:
The Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Amendment Bill, 2020 is a law for the national and internal security. Its main motive is to ensure that foreign funds don't dominate the political and social discourse of India: Minister of State MHA Nityanand Rai, in Rajya Sabha pic.twitter.com/oiCiqha2QW

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: Rajya Sabha passes The Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Amendment Bill, 2020
details.content:
Rajya Sabha passes The Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Amendment Bill, 2020.

Lok Sabha had passed the Bill on 21st September. pic.twitter.com/HgyaSENF6Q

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: Rajya Sabha bids farewell to 11 retiring members .
details.content:
Rajya Sabha on Wednesday bid farewell to 11 of its members who will retire in November this year.

When the House met, Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu mentioned that 11 MPs from Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand will be retiring in November.

They include Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri, Samajwadi Party leader Ram Gopal Yadav, BSP's Veer Singh and Raj Babbar of Congress.

Others who will retire are: Javed Ali Khan (SP), P L Punia (Congress), Rajaram (BSP), Neeraj Shekhar (BJP), Arun Singh (BJP), Ravi Prakash Verma (SP) and Chandrapal Singh Yadav (SP).

details.title: RS passes Bilateral Netting of Qualified Financial Contracts Bill, 2020
details.content:
Rajya Sabha passes the Bilateral Netting of Qualified Financial Contracts Bill, 2020.

Lok Sabha had passed the Bill on 20th September. pic.twitter.com/Knqy7rlUyy

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: Opposition parties stage joint protest in Parliament premises over farm bills
details.content:
Opposition parties stage joint protest in Parliament premises over farm bills. Placards of 'Save Farmers' and 'Save Farmers, Save Workers, Save Democracy' seen.

Congress' Ghulam Nabi Azad, TMC's Derek O'Brien, and NCP's Praful Patel present, among others. pic.twitter.com/aRufnzHfy8

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: Opposition to meet President today over farm Bills, suspension of MPs: Sources
details.content:
Congress MP and Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Ghulam Nabi Azad will meet President Ram Nath Kovind at 5 pm on Wednesday over the farm Bills and the suspension of the eight MPs, sources said.

"The President has given us time and the LoP in Rajya Sabha Ghulam Nabi Azad will meet him at 5 pm," a senior Opposition leader told PTI.(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: The Occupational Safety, Health And Working Conditions Code, 2020 guarantees wage, social & health security for labourers: Javadekar
details.content:
73 yrs after independence, labourers are getting the right they'd been waiting for. The Bills guarantee wage, social & health security: Union Minister P Javadekar on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, Industrial Relations Code & Code on Social Security Bill pic.twitter.com/dNAEJc6FKE

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: Rajya Sabha passes the Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020, the Industrial Relations Code 2020 and the Code on Social Security, 2020.
details.content:
Rajya Sabha passes the Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020, the Industrial Relations Code 2020 and the Code on Social Security, 2020.

Lok Sabha had passed the Bills yesterday. pic.twitter.com/fUiUJHXgga

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: Rajya Sabha passes three more bills
details.content:
Rajya Sabha passes the Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020, the Industrial Relations Code 2020 and the Code on Social Security, 2020.

Lok Sabha had passed the Bills yesterday. pic.twitter.com/fUiUJHXgga

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: Opposition leaders protest farm and labour Bills
details.content: TMC MP Derek O'Brien, Congress MP Ghulam Nabi Azad and other opposition lawmakers march from Gandhi statue to Ambedkar statue in protest against the recent farm and labour bills. (Photo| PTI)

details.title: SAD MP demands inclusion of Punjabi in J&K languages Bill
details.content: Unfortunate that Punjabi isn't being included in this Bill, as an official language in J&K. Punjabi is the richest & oldest language of north India, with its own script Gurmukhi: Shiromani Akali Dal MP Naresh Gujral, in Rajya Sabha, on Jammu Kashmir Official Languages Bill, 2020.

details.title: Rajya Sabha passes fifth Bill of the day
details.content: Using the Opposition's absence in their favour, the Rajya Sabha passed the Jammu and Kashmir Official Languages Bill, 2020.

details.title: Three money Bills returned in Upper House
details.content: Money Bills -The Appropriation (No. 3) Bill, 2020 and The Appropriation (No. 4) Bill, 2020 returned in Rajya Sabha.

details.title: Monsoon Session to conclude today
details.content: Rajya Sabha chairman announced that the 252nd session of the Upper House will be concluded today. The Monsoon Session which was initially scheduled to have 18 sittings will end after the 10th day of business.

details.title: Chairman receives letter from opposition leaders
details.content:
The Chairman says he received a letter by Leader of Opposition Ghulam Nabi Azad and other suspended leaders asking not to pass the three labour codes in their absence.

However, he says he has decided to ahead with the Bills after checking precedence.

details.title: Chairman makes his concluding remarks
details.content: Chairman Venkaiah Naidu says that in the 10 sittings, 25 bills were passed and 6 bills were introduced. "3.15 hours were lost due to disruptions. 57 per cnt of total functional time of the House was spent on legislative business. House had a productivity rate of 147 per cent. 1,567 unstarred questions were replied to in writing," he says.

details.title: Chairman comes down heavily on Opposition leaders
details.content:
Coming down heavily on Opposition leaders for their behaviour in the Upper House, he said, "it pains me when the Chair is rendered helpless and is forced to take decisions against members".

To protest is the right of the Opposition. The floor of the House is the most effective way, not through boycott, he added.

details.title: Opposition MPs continue their protest
details.content:
Delhi: TMC & TRS MPs protest in front of Gandhi statue in Parliament premises over agriculture Bills pic.twitter.com/tQKzW9xeZM

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: Lok Sabha convenes
Lowe House to take up 3 Bills for consideration
details.content:
• The Major Port Authorities Bill, 2020
  • The Assisted Reproductive Technology (Regulation) Bill, 2020
  • The Factoring Regulation (Amendment) Bill, 2020

details.title: Need new laws to govern social media: Tejasvi Surya
details.content: Bengaluru BJP MP Tejasvi Surya, addressing the House during Zero Hour asked the government to bring new laws to govern social media in a bid to protect freedom of speech of those with nationalist emotions.

details.title: No govt study to assess impact of COVID-19 on children
details.content:
In a written reply, the junior health minister said, "The Government has not conducted any study to assess the impact of COVID 19 lockdown on the physical and mental health of children". 

"During the Pandemic, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has issued guidelines for continuity of all essential services including child health. However, realizing the impact that COVID- 19 may have on the mental health of children and may cause anxiety in them, the Government has taken a number of initiatives to provide psychosocial support during COVID 19," he stated.

details.title: Opposition requests President Kovind not to give assent to contentious farm bills
details.content: Opposition parties have requested President Ram Nath Kovind not to give his assent to the contentious farm bills, and conveyed to him that their passage in Rajya Sabha was "unconstitutional", Ghulam Nabi Azad said on Wednesday.

details.title: Lok Sabha adjourned
details.content:
Lok Sabha adjourned sine die; monsoon session scheduled to go on till October 1st, cut short in the wake of #COVID19 pandemic pic.twitter.com/i5NoL7grBJ

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: Opposition continues protest against farm bills
details.content:
Delhi: Opposition MPs staged a protest against the recently passed agriculture Bills in Parliament premises, earlier today. pic.twitter.com/a4pyiDOTdb

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: WATCH | Union Minister Smriti Irani lashes out at Congress
details.content:
#WATCH Congress in its 10 years in power didn't implement Swaminathan Report. Modi Govt implemented the report & gave 1.5 times higher MSP. Under Kisan Samman Nidhi Scheme, more than Rs 90,000 Cr was transferred into the accounts of more than 10 Cr farmers: Union Min Smriti Irani pic.twitter.com/Em2NlHr5Kr

— ANI (@ANI) September 23, 2020

details.title: Lok Sabha adjourned Sine Die
details.content:
• Lok Sabha was adjourned sine die on Wednesday evening, bringing the Monsoon Session of Parliament to an end eight days ahead of schedule. Rajya Sabha was adjourned sine die this afternoon.
  • The session started on September 14 amid the coronavirus pandemic. In a first, the two Houses met at different times in a day to ensure social distancing norms against the backdrop of the COVID-19 outbreak.
  • Speaker Om Birla adjourned the House sine die after the passage of the Major Port Authorities Bill. Prime Minister Narendra Modi was present when the House was adjourned.
